Articles.Content: I'd like to be able to adjust RCS thrust in the VAB (personally I think it should be set in the VAB/SPH and not adjustable in-flight). There isn't much variation in thrusters available, only a few mod parts are anything other than 1.0 thrust. Given that craft with too much manouvering power can act strangely on SAS/MechJeb, I think this would be very useful.
Nice idea, good for when I want to use vernors on small probes.

Best you can do in stock is toggle Precision Controls on with CapsLock so that the thrust amounts are greatly reduced, unless you hold the key down for a while (or whatever you've bound under OSX which doesn't let you use CapsLock)

On the mod side changing the thruster scale with TweakScale is another option with pretty fine control over your desired thrust level

Does anyone else find tweakscale a bit "cheaty" though? (In career mode anyway)

It essentially multiplies your variety of parts available by several times, only need to unlock one engine really (one fuel tank etc.)
More like three engines. Lvt-45 lv-909 mainsail (there is no heavy lift 1.25m engine,another thing very needed)

Yeah, you do, but one of the things that I find drives me most in career games is *not* having the perfect parts all the time, and having to work to unlock them via research.

If you're sandboxing though, tweakscale is awesome.

Best you can do in stock is toggle Precision Controls on with CapsLock so that the thrust amounts are greatly reduced, unless you hold the key down for a while (or whatever you've bound under OSX which doesn't let you use CapsLock)

Actually, Precision Controls is way cooler than that for RCS-- activating it actually makes the RCS thrusters auto-adjust their strength for off-center CoM so that you get "correct" wobble-free lateral thrusting.

Detailed discussion here.
RCS thrusters act through a moment arm, you can reduce their effective turning power by placing them closer to the CoM. Not that this is a bad idea, just a possible workaround.

Yeah tweakable thrusters would be nice. Also RCS-thrusters are usually not used to rotate, only to translate and thats why the above post is kinda pointless. Either tweakable or different sizes. I'd kinda prefer the latter and I'd prefer actually new 5-way RCS-thrusters because then you only need 2 instead of 3(!) or 4. They should come in strengths of 0.5kn, 1kn, 2kn, 4kn, 8kn or so. Currently it's really a problem for example to create dockable lightweight probes because their RCS setup weighs as much as the rest of the probe.

Given that craft with too much manouvering power can act strangely on SAS/MechJeb, I think this would be very useful.

Best to use tweakables if you ask me, those can extend the functionality of lots of parts we already have if implemented properly.
